The two Exercises above can be generalised as in the following Key Point.

Key Point

  1. The general solution to: \(\dfrac{d^2y}{dx^2}-n^2y=0\) is \[ y=Ae^{nx}+B e^{-nx}\] or, equivalently using hyperbolic functions, \[ y=C\cosh nx+D\sinh nx.\]
  2. The general solution to: \(\dfrac{d^2y}{dx^2}+n^2y=0\) is \[ y=A\cos nx+B\sin nx.\]

Those of you who are familiar with elementary dynamics will recognise the second differential equation in the above Key Point as modelling simple harmonic motion.
